subject: Re: tests do not run after adding another suite to AllTests

David,

Thanks for getting back to me. I was hoping I was doing something
i=
diotically silly and would be obvious to others. Alas...

Yes, I am using a=
nt under cygwin on windows xp. I have not tried
running from command line, =
nor from within Eclipse, which obviously
implies not running from a debugge=
r. I am not sure how I would do that
in Eclipse, to tell you the truth. I h=
ave never done this, but see my
junit recipes book discusses running tests =
from within eclipse. I'll
give that a try later today.

I did comment out t=
he various AllTests and found the offender. That
AllTest only executed one =
test. So, I added a target for the one
offending test class. When running t=
hat, the response is the same as
below. It appears to be not running the te=
st at all.

I am using the ant junit command. I doubt the problem is in the=
 ant
script as there are several targets that do work, and even the one
All=
Test works as long as I comment out the offending reference to
AllTest with=
in that class.

I want this to work, of course, but I have to meet prod sch=
edules so
I've tested in other ways. 

I'll post a reply once I've tried yo=
ur suggestions. In the meantime,
if you think of any other suggestions, I'd=
 appreciate it.

Bill

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "David Saff" <saff@...=
> wrote:
>
> Bill,
> 
> On the face of it, there's nothing that seems obvio=
usly wrong, nor can I
> think of a common mistake that would lead to that b=
ehavior.  There's a
> couple ways to drive debugging from here, in order:
>=
 
> 1) It looks like you're using ant.  Does either suite run from the
comm=
and
> line, or from within an IDE like Eclipse?
> 2) Can you run the suite =
in a debugger (say, in Eclipse)?
> 3) Can you "delta debug" by commenting o=
ut lines in the offending
suite, and
> drive down to a particular problem c=
lass?
> 4) What ant command are you using?
> 
> Good luck,
> 
>    David Sa=
ff
>
